file_content.text: Hurry to Dromund Kaas, apprentice. We can talk more there.
You must meet me on Dromund Kaas. There we can talk more.
Dromund Kaas. Got it.
Understood.
Yes, the map guides us there... to the capital of the Sith Empire.
Why must we go there?
Dromund Kaas?
That is where the map leads--though I likely would have taken you there anyway. The capital of the Sith Empire is a good place for an apprentice to start.
I don't think I've ever heard of it.
That's new to me.
Dromund Kaas is the capital of the Sith Empire. It is a dark place, charged with dark energy. It's also the first location on the map.
I must finish some things here first, but you should board the shuttle to Dromund Kaas as soon as possible. You've made enemies here on Korriban.
I will meet you in my chambers in the Citadel in Kaas City. There we can speak more freely of the work ahead--without the fear of unfriendly ears.
I'll go just as soon as I finish up here.
I still have work here.
Good. Do what you must, then meet me there.
On my way.
If anyone's listening, I'll cut their ears off.
Eavesdroppers will suffer.
No need for that. My chambers on Dromund Kaas are well-guarded against that sort of thing.
Oh--and one more thing. You're Sith now, which means you get your own lightsaber.
This is the lightsaber I had as an apprentice. I want you to have it.
My pleasure.
And what a fine weapon of murder it is. I've always wanted one of these.
Great.
Excellent. I'm glad you like it. It served me well.
I shall wreak havoc with it wherever I go.
I'll use it well.
Magnificent. No doubt you will.
Now, remember. My chambers. The Citadel. Dromund Kaas. It's imperative that we get to work on this as soon as possible.
Stop right there, alien scum. Darth Skotia has a message for you.
Stop right there, slave. Darth Skotia has a message for you.
I am a Sith apprentice. Show some respect or I'll smash your face in.
You're asking for trouble.
Shut up, you insignificant worm.
Who is this Darth Skotia?
Darth Skotia?
Darth Skotia is Lord Zash's superior and your worst nightmare.
Give me the message.
Speak.
The message is this: You will not go to Dromund Kaas.
Who said anything about going to Dromund Kaas?
I'm not going.
Everything you've done here, everyone you dealt with--Lord Zash included--is insignificant.
Darth Skotia has eyes and ears on Korriban. He knows what your master is up to, and he is displeased to say the least.
On Korriban, Lord Zash may have her way. But on Dromund Kaas, it's a different story. So you see, you have to die.
Khem, what is it you do to Force users again?
Khem, show him your talent.
Um, Ortosin--is that a Dashade? Maybe this isn't such a good idea.
Coward! Fight, you fool!
Actually, you're the one who's going to die.
You will suffer.
I've been waiting to give my new lightsaber a try!
This'll be fun!
Oh, slave, I'm going to enjoy tearing you to bits.
Ah, my magnificent new apprentice. Congratulations are in order, I believe.
You know, I could have taken Ffon. You didn't need to kill him for me.
I didn't need your help.
You know, I could have taken Ffon. I didn't need you to kill him for me.
I didn't need your help.
Yes, of course, but it wouldn't have made that stubborn overseer respect your power. So I reminded him of mine instead.
I'm grateful.
You've earned it, my apprentice.
Was killing Ffon really necessary? He couldn't help it that Harkun was a jerk.
I feel bad for Ffon.
Was killing Ffon really necessary? He couldn't help it that Harkun is a fool.
I feel bad for Ffon.
Of course it was. I can only have one apprentice.
Now, I was just looking over this astonishing map you brought back, and I can tell we have a lot of work ahead of us.
What is this map of, exactly?
Map?
What is this a map of, exactly?
Map?
We can't talk about it here--too many unfriendly ears.
Oh boy!
Patience, my apprentice. We must go about this with tact. All in good time.
You mean I have a lot of work ahead of me.
Us? You mean "me."
You think I don't work, apprentice? I'd remind you that there is more to being Sith than crushing tuk'ata skulls and mulling about dark tombs.
You and I are a special breed. We reach beyond the mere momentary passion of combat into the very heart of the dark side.
We are masters of secrets. Even our own shadows don't know our next move. Do you understand?
Yes.
But what's the point of having all this power if you can't kill things?
But I like causing trouble.
There will be plenty of time for that.
Yes, I am darkness!
I am powerful!
Excellent. This is positively thrilling.
Please, please--I must work now. This text--so exciting!
Remarkable. Magni--oh, hello again, acolyte.
I was just in the midst of decoding the marvelous text you brought back from the tomb of Tulak Hord.
I can't say for sure, but it looks every bit as promising as the holocron.
Good.
You've been an immense help. This is--well, it's beyond my wildest imagination, and I've only skimmed the surface.
I'd have thought you would have read it by now, if it's so exciting.
You haven't read it?
Oh, I've read it hundreds of times by now. It's a very pretty verse in the ancient Sith tongue--but it's nonsense.
My research suggested that the text was important--that's why I sent you for it. That the text and the holocron were connected wasn't clear until I used the holocron.
But it's true--there's a second text buried in the first, one which I never would have seen without the holocron! And I am nearly finished decoding it!
Amazing. I never would have imagined it.
Fascinating.
So the text is some sort of code?
Decoding?
Yes! It's absolutely magnificent. Ingenious, even.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I must get back to it immediately--and you have business to go about, certainly.
Good luck.
Thank you very much, acolyte.
Will you let me know how it turns out?
Keep me informed.
Absolutely! Your help has been invaluable. It's the least I can do.
And good luck dealing with Harkun--best not to keep him waiting, I think.
That fool Harkun can wait.
I have time.
The trial is nothing. It can wait.
I have time.
Well, I don't think you should keep him waiting. You'd best go.
Boring.
Your interests may lie elsewhere, acolyte, but you would do well to remember that knowledge is also a form of strength for the Sith.
I won't delay you longer.
I have to get back to Harkun now.
I must leave.
Well, I have to go to the training grounds now.
I must leave.
All right--better not keep Overseer Harkun waiting. He has a nasty temper.
I'll be sure to find you when I have the text fully decoded.
Yes--yes. Remarkable. Magnificent.
You--you, slave. Wai--no, acolyte, you're the one who brought me this magnificent holocron from the tomb of Marka Ragnos, yes?
Yes, my lord. I found the holocron.
Indeed, Lord Zash.
It was nothing.
Is there something wrong?
Why do you ask?
Unbelievable. One thousand years, buried in that tomb. Sith Lords passing it by. And then--the most unlikely person comes along.
Tell me--how did you manage it?
I shot lightning at it, and it opened.
It was easy.
Such a simple solution--why did none of us think of that?
We must have thought too deeply on it, believed too strongly that it could not be done. Or perhaps we were simply not meant to open it.
I'm not telling.
Good. You guard your secrets well. This is a credit to you and a source of power. Though I personally prefer to be more open.
I had to sacrifice seven tuk'ata and eat their hearts.
[Lie] It was quite the ritual.
Really? How strange. It didn't work when I tried it.
Do you realize what a truly magnificent discovery this holocron is?
Judging from your reaction, I'd say I have a good guess.
Maybe.
You're going to tell me?
Why wouldn't I tell you? This is far too remarkable a discovery to be kept secret--especially from the person who made it!
Well, if I did it, it must be great.
I am amazing.
I always believed this holocron contained some small secret of Marka Ragnos--an arcane philosophy or an incantation perhaps. It is much bigger than that.
This isn't Marka Ragnos's holocron. It belonged to Tulak Hord! The most mysterious Dark Lord of them all. It is the key to his long sought-after power!
It means Tulak Hord must have built the tombs himself, long before Marka Ragnos or Naga Sadow were even born! And his power is finally in reach!
I'm happy to help.
I look forward to seeing more of the wonderful fruits of your labor, acolyte.
Well aren't you the lucky one?
Good for you.
And you as well, if my estimation of Harkun's trials is correct.
Look, I've got to get back to Harkun.
I have to go.
I won't delay you longer, but you must know--
Your work so far--in bringing back this holocron and now the text from Tulak Hord's tomb--has me intrigued.
I am watching your progress eagerly. I have high hopes for you, acolyte. Sky high.
Really? Harkun seems to favor Ffon.
That overseer disagrees.
Harkun's only purpose is to weed out the weak. Beyond that, his opinion means nothing.
I hope I live up to them.
I'm honored.
Anything to do my part.
Yes--yes. Remarkable. Magnificent.
Good luck, acolyte. Good luck.
Sorry, can't stop to talk. Too much to plan, too much to do.
Sorry, I've no time to talk.
Now, I am eager to discuss this map with you further, but we can't do it here. There are too many unfriendly ears on Korriban.
I'm confused.
Step aside.
I consume them and spit out their bones.
Let's not fight.
